questions.question: What is the formula for the di-substituted axial-axial isomer produced by refluxing compound 1 in iso-nicotinic acid?
What type of geometry does the Cu(II) ion exhibit in the 1D polymer formed by reacting compound 2 with copper nitrate?
How does the [3]-rotaxane {(H2T1)[Cr7NiF8(O2CtBu)16]2} (7) link to metal sites to form a 1D polymer?
questions.answer: Through pyridine groups at each end of the thread that can coordinate to metal ions

questions.question: What is the result of the reaction between compound 7 and [Cu2(O2CtBu)4]?
questions.answer: A poly-[3]-rotaxane 8, where the pyridine groups from 7 bind to the axial sites of the Cu(II) ions in [Cu2(O2CtBu)4] dimers, producing a 1D polymer

questions.question: True or False: The [3]-rotaxane [{H2T2}{Cr7NiF8(O2CCMe3)16}2] (10) allows for the formation of a polymer with [Cu(Hfacec)2] due to the extra CH2 group between the amine and the pyridyl moiety.
What is the significance of the cis-conformation of [Cu(Hfacec)2] in the formation of discrete molecules with the [3]-rotaxane 7?
questions.answer: The cis-conformation facilitates coordination to the ends of the thread in [3]-rotaxane 7, resulting in discrete molecules rather than a continuous 1D polymer

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of the [3]-rotaxane {(H2T1)[Cr7NiF8(O2CtBu)16]2} involves replacing the diisopropylamine with N,N'-bis(pyridin-4-ylmethyl)decane-1,10-diamine (T1) during the synthesis of the {Cr7Ni} wheel.
What is the role of the [Cu2(O2CtBu)4] units in the structure of the poly-[3]-rotaxane 8?
questions.answer: They prevent the {Cr7Ni} clusters from slipping along the entire length of the polymer chain, making each repeat unit a discrete [3]-rotaxane

questions.question: True or False: The poly-[3]-rotaxane 8 is structurally similar to other metalâ€“organic rotaxane frameworks that polymerize through linking the rings of adjacent rotaxanes.
What is the potential application of designing complex 1D-coordination polymers using functionalized inorganic nanoscale clusters as described in the text?
questions.answer: One potential application is to make a 1D-polymer that matches quantum simulators, which requires different magnetic spin centres linked into a polymer.
